document.title: The inclusion map from the integers to the reals and universal properties of the floor and ceiling functions

para.p:
If
X
is a set, by a partial order on
X
we mean a binary relation
≤
on
X
that is reflexive, antisymmetric, and transitive, and we call
( X , ≤ )
a poset. If
( X , ≤ )
is a poset, we define it to be a category whose objects are the elements of
X
, and for
∈
x , y
X
,

Math.text: Hom * open-interval@(x, y) = cases@(set@(open-interval@(x, y)), x less= y, empty-set, not@(x less= y))

para.p:
In particular,

id x

Math.text: U * id _ j = U * open-interval@(j, j) = open-interval@(U * j, U * j) = id _ (U * j)

Math.text: ((U * open-interval@(k, l)) compose U) * open-interval@(j, k) = open-interval@(U * k, U * l) compose open-interval@(U * j, U * k) = open-interval@(U * j, U * l) = U * open-interval@(j, l) = U * (open-interval@(j, l) compose open-interval@(j, k))

para.p:
This shows that
: U
→
( Z , ≤ )
( R , ≤ )
is a functor.

If
( A , ≤ )
and
( B , ≤ )
are posets, a function
: G
→ A B
is said to be order-preserving if
≤ a
a ′
implies
≤
⁢ G
( a )
⁢ G
(
a ′
)
. A Galois connection from
A
to
B
is an order-preserving function
: G
→ A B
and an order-preserving function
: H
→ B A
such that

Math.tex: \textrm{$G(a)\leq b$ if and only if $a\leq H(b)$},\qquad a\in A,\quad b\in B.
Math.text: formulae@(list@([≤⁢G(a)b if and only if ≤a⁢H(b)], a) element-of A, b element-of B)

para.p:
We say that
G
is the left-adjoint of
H
and that
H
is the right-adjoint of
G
.

Math.tex: I(n)\leq x\iff n\leq F(x),\qquad n\in\mathbb{Z},\quad x\in\mathbb{R}.
Math.text: I * n less= x iff formulae@(n less= F * x, formulae@(n element-of Z, x element-of R))

Math.tex: C(x)\leq n\iff x\leq I(n),\qquad x\in\mathbb{R},\quad n\in\mathbb{Z}.
Math.text: C * x less= n iff formulae@(x less= I * n, formulae@(x element-of R, n element-of Z))
floor@(square-root@(floor@(x))) = floor@(square-root@(x))

Math.text: floor@(floor@(x) / n) = floor@(x / n)

Math.text: k less= F * ((I * F * x) / I) * n iff I * k less= ((I * F * x) / I) * n

p.text:
If
∈ n
Z
≥
1
and
∈ m Z
, then

Math.text: ceiling@(m / n) = floor@(((m + n) - 1) / n)

para.p:

∈ k Z

Math.text: k less= F * ((I * ((m + n) - 1)) / I) * n iff I * k less= ((I * ((m + n) - 1)) / I) * n
k less= F * ((I * ((m + n) - 1)) / I) * n
absent iff I * k less= ((I * ((m + n) - 1)) / I) * n
absent iff I * k * I * n less= I * ((m + n) - 1)
absent iff I * k * I * n less= I * ((m + n) - 1)
absent iff k * n less= (m + n) - 1
absent iff k * n less= (m + n) - 1
absent iff (k * n - n) + 1 less= m
absent iff (k * n - n) + 1 less= m
absent iff k * n - n less m
absent iff k * n - n less m
absent iff I * (k - 1) less ((I * m) / I) * n
absent iff I * (k - 1) less ((I * m) / I) * n
